main event: A civilian reported seeing an orange object resembling a comet with a speck in front of it, traveling at supersonic speed in Tuscaloosa, Alabama on December 17, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as orange and was observed traveling at supersonic speeds.
A speck was observed in front of the object, adding to the mystery.
The observation was made through binoculars, indicating a deliberate effort to observe the object.
The report suggests the possibility of the object being a comet, but the conclusion leans towards it being a meteor.
Weather and wind conditions at the time and location of the sighting are detailed, providing additional context for the observation.
